title: Lowes employee gets assaulted by shoplifters, yet still got fired over company's "zero tolerance" party
description:
Donna Hansbrough was assaulted by three thugs while working at Lowes. She was also fired by Lowes. Donna was hanging on to the other end of the shopping cart full of merchandise the thugs were trying to steal, so they punched her in the face. Repeatedly. Lowes fired her over their "zero tolerance" policy because, like what feels like most corporate chains in this country, they care more about criminals than they do people.

Donna was in tears when she talked to the press. She loved her job, her customers, and the people she worked with. Lowes, a publicly-traded company where The Vanguard Group the majority shareholder, doesn't care. Side note: The second-largest shareholder is BlackRock

— (@)

Donna was punched three times in the face, causing her right eye to swell and blacken. Police confirmed she did not make any physical contact with the three thugs. Yet still: "Lowes stated that Donna's actions (grabbing the cart) was a violation of their policy and Donna was terminated as a result."

Donna had been an employee there for thirteen years.

— (@)

Yet another example of why, while I understand the instinct to get involved, it's a corporate chain and is simply not worth it. If you are defending a small, independently owned business, that's one thing and encouraged. But time and again, these companies have made it clear they don't care about you. Start caring less about them.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Shop owner melts down after getting punched in the face by a guy peeing in the street: "I'm fed up with this city"
description:
Peterson Harter has the thankless job of attempting to run a small business in San Francisco. Decades of progressive voters electing progressive politicians to enact progressive policies have left the city crime-ridden and overrun by homeless, drug addicts, and homeless drug addicts. There is so much human sh*t in the street, someone created an app so people could avoid the sh*t.

Harter reached his breaking point after being assaulted by a man he asked to please stop peeing outside on his store.

— (@)
I can't believe I live in a city where people just pissin' the street and come and punch you in the face and get away with it. The guy just ran off. They're probably not gonna find him. I'm f*cking fed up with this godd*mn city. I can't just be outside and just running a f*cking business without getting punched in the godd*mn face.

He went on to say the city shouldn't be like that. And he's right. No city should be like that. But you get the city you vote for. Case-in-point, many of you reading this live in real America. You can run and patronizes business without having to step over puddles of urine.

I will be fair to San Franciscans somewhat. There are signs they are getting fed up, and I don't mean the costumed vigilante Boots. Over the past year, voters have recalled a school board and their District Attorney because they had gone too woke even by San Francisco standards. Though instead of acknowledging the pushback, in both cases the influence of Republican billionaires was blamed for the recalls. Yes. Republican influence... in San Francisco. Nothing is EVER the fault of progressive policies.

The rub is the same voters then elect people who are every bit as bad. People like San Francisco mayor London Breed who, instead of acknowledging the problems, lashes out at people who acknowledge the problems and would rather focus on climate change and artificial intelligence.

It doesn't have to be like this in American cities. People who live there have to want to do something about it.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Update on the first trans lawmaker who shattered another glass ceiling as the first trans lawmaker arrested for kiddie porn
description:
Stacie Marie Laughton shattered a glass ceiling becoming America's first transgender lawmaker. In June, she/her shattered another glass ceiling becoming America's first transgender lawmaker to be arrested on child exploitation charges. Further disturbing details have come out that also implicated Laughton's former girlfriend, who was also a school teacher.

Laughton resigned she/her position as New Hampshire state representative in December 2022. Prior to that, the Democrat Party was excited to be shattering the glass ceiling. So much so, stalwarts like Beto O'Rourke and Rep. Eric Swallows went to New Hampshire to campaign for the local election.

— (@)

Laughton was also an avid Bud Light drinker.

— (@)

Laughton was arrested in June on charges she/her allegedly distributed child sexual abuse images. New details have come out about where and how she/her allegedly obtained the images. Laughton's former girlfriend Lindsay Groves was a teacher at a daycare center. Groves, allegedly, used the children's bathroom breaks to take photos of the kids and send them to Laughton. This includes diaper changes.

There were over 2,500 text messages between Laughton and Groves on the phones obtained by the prosecution. These included at least four sexually explicit pictures of children between three and five years of age.

According to the Boston Herald, in one alleged text from Groves, she said to Laughton, “I want to do this with you with one of my kids.” The text was in conjunction with a picture focused on the genitals of a prepubescent boy.

Stacie Laughton has been charged with one count of sexual exploitation of children and aiding and abetting. Groves, who was employed by the daycare center until this past June, has also been charged with child exploitation. The charge carries a sentence of at least fifteen years in prison, at least five years of supervised release, and a fine of up to $250,000.

>

<

title: Shrill, gun-control harpy brags about getting Jason Aldean's "Try That in A Small Town" canceled from CMT
description:
Jason Aldean's anti-Democrat Party platform anthem "Try That in A Small Town" is #1 in the charts. The videos is viewed all over Twitter and the rest of social media. The controversy has promoted the video and made it more popular than it would have ever been. So much so, I follow country music and had no idea it existed until it became culture war content. It even debuted on network television.

HOWEVER, leftists were able to get the video pulled from the NYC-baed MTV-owned CMT. And for that, shrill gun control harpy Shannon Watts wants you to know, "Yeah, I did that."

— (@)

Gun Control Karen (shout out to whoever first came up with that on Twitter) repeats every other leftist talking point. Where Watts' particular set of derp, derp she's acquired over a very long career, comes in is where Aldean sings about the right to self-defense and the government coming to take that right away. Watts makes a lot of money advocating for those rights to be taken away.

She points to Aldean performing on stage during the 2017 Las Vegas shooting. The one where six years later, we still don't know who did it. There are people in America who see tragedies like that and don't want their government to further make it more difficult for them to defend themselves. Especially a government that still hasn't found the guy who did it. And then there are people like Shannon Watts who are all over the media, vote for progressives, and wonder why their cities aren't safe.

But none of this touches on the most ridiculous part of Gun Control Karen bragging about how she got the video pulled from CMT.

Who the f*ck watches videos on television anymore?

People watch videos on YouTube. They watch it on Twitter. They buy it from iTunes. All Watts did was cause Aldean's video to receive less than ten extra plays a day on a low-rated cable television station. Congratulations?

— (@)

>

<
